msContents.summary: Greek fragment of the Apocalypse of John containing 3:19-4:3

msItemStruct.note: Side 1: 16 lines written on the hair side, quite legible
Side 2: 15 lines written on the flesh side, less legible
Very regular mid-sized uncial hand, with some ornamentation; a few marginalia by a later corrector (e.g., rough breating mark (?) at l. 12; final letters of l. 19)
Pages numbered LG (33) and LD (34), respectively, in upper outside corners; apparently a page from a pocket codex of the Apocalypse of John (cf. P.Oxy. 842, 1010, 1096; P.Rylands 28)
Text is generally in agreement with codex B
Homoioteleuton (thuran kai) at l. 3; the missing text is supplied by the original hand at bottom (ll. 15-16) of side 1
Gregory-Aland no. 0169; Pap. 5, Special Collections, Luce Library, Princeton Theological Seminary, Princeton, N.J.

supportDesc.support: 9.5 x 7.8 cm. A nearly complete leaf from a miniature parchment codex; three sizeable holes across the middle; some discoloration at edges; slight puckering at top and middle.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt for the Egypt Exploration Fund in 1906; donated to Princeton Theological Seminary in 1915 through an arrangment with Prof. William Park Armstrong.

div.ab: [Side 1:] Be earnest, therefore, and repent. Behold, I stand at the door and knock. If anyone hears my voice and opens the door, I will come in to him, and I will dine with him, and he with me. The one who conquers, to him I will give to sit with me on my throne, just as I myself conquered and sat with my father on his throne. The one who has ears, let him hear what the spirit says to the churches. After [Side 2:] these things I saw, and behold, a door opened in heaven, and the first voice, which I heard speaking to me like a trumpet, saying, *Come up here, and I will show you what must happen after these things.* Immediately I was in the spirit, and behold, a throne stood in heaven, and one sitting on the throne, and the one sitting on the throne was like in appearance
